com.github.rholder.fauxflake.provider.boundary

Class FlakeEncodingProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.rholder.fauxflake.provider.boundary.FlakeEncodingProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EncodingProvider

    public class FlakeEncodingProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements EncodingProvider
    This class provides functionality for working with Flake-style unique identifiers, defined as being a 128-bit unsigned long value where the first 64 bits store the number of milliseconds from the epoch, the next 48 bits are the machine id, and the final 16 bits are a sequence number. The beginning of time (epoch) is measured as the number of milliseconds from the Unix epoch.

    See http://boundary.com/blog/2012/01/12/flake-a-decentralized-k-ordered-unique-id-generator-in-erlang/ for more about the Flake identifier specification developed by Boundary.

      FlakeEncodingProvider(long machineId) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] encodeAsBytes(long time, int sequence)
      Return a 128-bit version of the given time and sequence numbers according to the Flake specification.
      long encodeAsLong(long time, int sequence)
      This always throws an UnsupportedOperationException since the output of this EncodingProvider doesn't fit in 4 bytes.
      java.lang.String encodeAsString(long time, int sequence)
      Return the 32 character left padded hex version of the given id.
      int maxSequenceNumbers()
      Return the maximum number of sequence numbers that can be encoded for a given time by this implementation.
